fields.title: Horror Business
fields.introduction: A comic book genre that flourished briefly in America during the middle 1940s and early 1950s. The genre was infamous for its gruesomely illustrated tales of ghosts and ghouls.

fields.title: Carnal Knowledge
fields.introduction: Nice guy Sandy and charming schemer Jonathan meet as college roommates in the late 1940s. Sandy eventually marries the sweetly virginal Susan without knowing.

fields.title: Bread and Tulips
fields.introduction: During a family vacation on a bus tour, a woman is accidentally left behind at a rest stop. She quickly gets tired of waiting for her family to pick her up.

fields.title: Tomb of Ligeia
fields.introduction: Some years after having buried his beloved wife Ligea, Verden Fell meets and eventually marries the lovely Lady Rowena.

fields.title: Victory
fields.introduction: Victory (also published as Victory: An Island Tale) is a psychological novel by Joseph Conrad first published in 1915, through which Conrad achieved 'popular success.'

fields.title: Stakeout on Dope Street
fields.introduction: When a pusher is killed so he can't rat out the mob, his briefcase winds up in the hands of 18-year-old Ves, who finds it in the bushes.

fields.title: Scream of Fear
fields.introduction: A sociologist who moonlights at one of America's scariest and most popular haunted houses, she has seen grown men laugh, cry

fields.title: She's So Lovely
fields.introduction: A woman whose passion for two totally opposite men sets up an outrageously explosive love triangle! Maureen and first husband Eddie lived through some very wild times.

fields.title: Beethoven's 3rd
fields.introduction: On an ordinary Friday, in an ordinary street, the mother of two children hears two chords played on a piano and things begin to change......

fields.title: Planet 51
fields.introduction: Everything seemed to be going just right for Lem, until the day an astronaut dropped out of the sky and landed in his back yard.
